Dialogue: Happy couples eating, laughing, talking. Suddenly, Holmes hears no words. He just sees their mouths moving. The sound of silverware clinking and scraping on fine china rises to an ORCHESTRAL ROAR --  -- which becomes the ROAR of a BLOOD-THIRSTY MOB as a fist smashes into a face with a MEATY THUD.  15A-17 OMITTEDINT. PUNCH BOWL PUB - BARE-KNUCKLE BOXING FIGHT - 5A-17 1 NIGHT  Holmes staggers back from the blow. He tastes his own blood from a split lip. It interests him. He is stripped to the waist, all sinew and gristle. His opponent, McMURDO -- huge but flabby -- bangs his fists together and moves in.  Bets rage back and forth through the pressing CROWD.

Speaker: holmes' pov
Dialogue: The room and the fight are calm -- the sounds muffled and indistinct -- a complete sensory reversal of his experience in the restaurant. This is soothing to him, the ring is the only place where his mind stops racing.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Well done.   Thank you.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Not done. Finished. And as I said, thank you, it was most pleasurable.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: It is the fifth element -- the ethereal. That which can't yet be known.
102    CONTINUED:                                               102 WATSON It's right in the middle of the River Thames.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Police.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Ladies first.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Follow these plans.

Speaker: lord coward
Dialogue: Lestrade?

Speaker: lestrade
Dialogue: Begging your pardon, m'lord, I know it's unorthodox, but Mr. Holmes has been making serious accusations about you and the order, sir.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Oh, that solves the great mystery as to how you became inspector.

Speaker: lord coward
Dialogue: I have five minutes before my next engagement, why don't you regale me with your stories of conspiracies. Thank you, Lestrade, if you could wait outside.

106   CONTINUED:                                                  106 HOLMES I'm curious, Coward, did you assist Blackwood in all the murders or just the one I prevented? Very distinctive those hand-made shoes of yours, but the price of quality is the unique imprint they leave.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Nonetheless, I confess to being completely out-matched. I could deduce very little from my investigation.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Fortunately, there is nothing more stimulating than a case where everything goes against you. How many members of parliament do you intend to murder at noon today?  Man, ox, eagle, lion -- the lion is parliament, isn't it?

Speaker: lord coward
Dialogue: Very clever. But it's not murder, Mr. Holmes. It's mercy. We are giving the weak masses a strong shepherd. Don't you see it's for their own good?

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: No, but I don't care much what you think. I simply wanted to know the location of Blackwood's final ceremony, and now you have given it to me.

Speaker: lord coward
Dialogue: I have told you nothing.

106   CONTINUED:                                             106 A pair of handcuffs, slide across the floor to Coward's feet. He looks up and Holmes is nowhere to be found. Coward quickly moves across the room to lock the door.

Speaker: 94a/94b.
Dialogue: 106   CONTINUED:  Both Houses met today. The entire government will be present.

Speaker: lord coward
Dialogue: How terrible is wisdom, Holmes, when it brings no profit to the wise.  We take power at noon.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Well there's no time to waste then, is there?

107   CONTINUED:                                                   107 Holmes looks in the water and sees a rope trailing on the surface. He grabs it with his hands. And... it pulls him closer to the rickety boat of Captain Tanner.

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: I told you he'd be coming out the top window, soldier boy. No way he'd be coming over the terrace.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: How was Lestrade?

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Performed his role perfectly.   A little too perfectly, come to think of it.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Well, your instructions were fairly precise... about everything except the window.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Where to, Sherlock?

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Port side, Captain Tanner, into the sewers.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Watson, did you bring my clothes?

107    CONTINUED:                                               107 Then Holmes reaches inside a pocket of clothes he is still wearing, and pulls out the hip FLASK that he took from the men at the slaughterhouse. He takes a shot.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Starting early, aren't we?

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Trust me, have a drink.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: What are we doing in the sewers?

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Patience, Doctor. I am about to show you...

Speaker: tanner
Dialogue: Far as I can go.
110   CONTINUED:                                                 110 Holmes ducks around a corner, stops. Irene and Watson flank him, standing in shadows. They look down a long tunnel to:

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Behold, Blackwood's magic.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: A chemical weapon. The first of its kind. Cyanide, to be precise.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: You can tell that from here?

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: No.   I can tell it from here. He pulls something out of his pocket:    the RAT TAIL.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: I snipped this off a rather recumbent rat at the slaughterhouse. Note the blue discoloration, the faint smell of bitter almonds. Tell-tale signs of cyanide.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: That shaft leads directly to Parliament. When activated, those electrodes on either side will send a charge converting the cyanide powder into a gas.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: All of the people inside that building --

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Will be dead at the strike of noon.
110    CONTINUED:                                                110 HOLMES As if by magic. There will be no one left to stop Blackwood and his followers from assuming control.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Seven minutes to twelve...

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: I wouldn't.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: I'll keep these under wraps.
112   CONTINUED:                                                  112 HOLMES Take this.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Over there.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I've never seen anything like it.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: There's never been anything like it. A totally wire-free weapon. He must have some kind of remote device sending a signal to the receiver. Really quite --
112   CONTINUED:                                               112 Irene shoots one point blank with her Derringer, Holmes crushes the other's larynx.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Keep at it.

Speaker: lord coward
Dialogue: Look.
114   CONTINUED:                                                 114 IRENE  Nine strokes left.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: You owe me for the ring.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Give me your gun. The bullets, I need the bullets.
114    CONTINUED:                                                114 -- which shatters against the floor.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: We need a light, a match --

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Got it... Which is when a blood-maddened Dredger thunders into them both, arms wide, driving Holmes and Irene away from the device --

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Three.
116    CONTINUED:                                                  116 ON THE DEVICE AS IT GOES ACTIVE

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Two!

117    CONTINUED:                                                   117 BLACKWOOD You seem surprised. Did you really take me for a man who could be dispatched like a truculent servant? I see before me a conspiracy of arrogant old men puffed up by the illusion of their own vainglory. In your hands this once great parliament has become nothing more than a drunken satyr, stumbling about the world's stage seeking nothing more than to satiate your own lust and gluttony; your britches stained by the incontinence of your hypocrisy. I will not sit idly by and watch you violate the innocence of the public trust as you drag this great Empire into the quagmire that your pride has dug and filled with the excrement of your corruption. I am here to change all this.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: That was something new for us.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Yes... it was.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Watson --
118    CONTINUED:                                                   118 Holmes whips around -- sees Watson, seemingly dead. He goes to him, drops to his knees next to Watson, feels for a pulse.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: I'm pretty sure I heard the last chime.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Yes, we made it. Just.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Come on, you've got to admit, you're going to miss this.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Which part? The stench of the sewers or the broken bones?  My ankle's done.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Where's Irene?

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Holmes, I'm sorry...

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Make sure Lestrade keeps it intact.

Speaker: 110a.
Dialogue: 119H   CONTINUED:                                             119H Blackwood is DRAGGED down the walkway by the weight of the falling plank, pulled toward the edge.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: The simplest involved paying people off, like the prison guard...

Speaker: 110b.
Dialogue: 119H   CONTINUED:  Like all great performers you saved your piece de resistance for the end. Had it worked, your followers in Parliament would have watched unharmed as their colleagues were dying around them. They didn't know that you had given them the antidote -- at one of your ceremonies I suspect. Instead, they would have believed it was magic and that you harnessed the ultimate power.
119H   CONTINUED:                                             119H Blackwood struggles to hold on, he loses his grip for a second and is dragged back toward the precipice. Wind whips harder.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: You hated your father and the other members of the Temple of the Four Orders for what they did to you. How satisfying it must have been to use their own system against them.

Speaker: blackwood
Dialogue: Cut me loose, Holmes!

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: You better hope that it's nothing more than superstition as you performed all the rituals perfectly.
119H   CONTINUED: . He snatches the DIAMOND from around her neck, turns and walks away. She smiles, calls out:

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: You'll miss me, Sherlock.

Speaker: lestrade
Dialogue: It'll be a hell of a trick if Blackwood comes back from this one.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Thank you, Lestrade.

Speaker: lestrade
Dialogue: Now you're going to be even more arrogant and insufferable than ever.

Speaker: lestrade
Dialogue: You're welcome, detective.  Is the woman up there?

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: She won't be by the time your boys get there.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: One moment.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Please make sure this one is put on the desk in the front room.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: What's in all those notebooks?

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Nothing really... Just a few scribbles... cases we've worked on over the years.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: All your adventures... I'd love to read them sometime.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Do you think he's finally come to terms with you leaving?

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Of course.    No question about it --
123B   CONTINUED:                                             123B HOLMES I managed it with braces, belts and a coat hook. Please, Watson, my tongue is going next. I'll be of no use to you at all.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Worse things could happen.

123B   CONTINUED:                                             123B Watson feels for a pulse in his dog's neck -- he shakes his head. They are interrupted by a knock on the door. Constable Clark enters.

Speaker: constable clark
Dialogue: Mr. Holmes... Inspector Lestrade asks that you come with me, right away.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: What is it this time, Clarky?

Speaker: constable clark
Dialogue: It's one of our sergeants, sir. He went missing in the sewers, the day you stopped Lord Blackwood... Well, a maintenance man found his body this morning. We believe the sergeant was our first man on the scene. Shot in the head.

Speaker: 116a.
Dialogue: 123B   CONTINUED:                                               123B CONSTABLE CLARK The secret service has it, sir. They've taken over the case.

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Oi, what you doing?

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Were there powder burns on his eyebrows?

Speaker: constable clark
Dialogue: He was shot at point-blank range.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: There's a brave boy... There, there, everything's going to be all right.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Where is Blackwood's device now?

Speaker: constable clark
Dialogue: The secret service has it, sir. They've taken over the case.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: I'd wager there's a piece missing.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Wager, Watson... I thought those days were behind you. Excellent deduction, however.

Speaker: 117a.
Dialogue: 126   CONTINUED:                                                  126 WATSON Moriarty was after the machine not the poison.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Blackwood's wire-free invention was the game all along. It is undoubtedly the more dangerous and the more valuable of the two...  Irene was just a diversion.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: I've loaded the last of your boxes, sir.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Well...

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: I'll walk out with you...

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: An honor working with you, Doctor.

Speaker: watson
Dialogue: Take care of yourself, Holmes.

Speaker: mary
Dialogue: Try not to be too late for dinner with my parents and... be careful.

Speaker: holmes
Dialogue: Magnificent woman, Watson. Magnificent!
